member.name: P:Applitools.EyesBase.BranchName
member.summary: Gets or sets the branch in which the baseline for subsequent test runs resides. If the branch does not already exist it will be created under the specified parent branch . Changes made to the baseline or model of a branch do not propagate to other branches. A null branch name indicates the default branch.

member.name: P:Applitools.EyesBase.ParentBranchName
member.summary: Gets or sets the branch under which new branches are created. A null branch name indicates the default branch.

member.summary: User inputs collected between (or one of its overloads) invocations.

The gateway to the Eyes server.
The running session in which we should match the window.
The time allowed to retry matching in case of a mismatch.
Provides application output, given the input last application screenshot.

member.summary: The bounds of the last screenshot relative to the window.

member.summary: Message logger.

member.name: M:Applitools.MatchWindowTask.MatchWindow(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Applitools.Trigger},Applitools.Utils.Geometry.Region,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Applitools.ImageMatchSettings,System.Int32)
member.summary: Repeatedly obtains an application snapshot and matches it with the next expected output, until a match is found or the timeout expires.
member.param: User input preceding this match.
Window region to capture.
Optional tag to associated with the match (can be null.
Force a single match attempt at the end of the match timeout.
Whether to instruct the server to ignore the match attempt in case of a mismatch.
The settings to use.
The amount of time to retry matching in milliseconds or a negative value to use the default retry timeout.
member.returns: Returns the results of the match.

member.summary: Returns the total number of test steps.

member.name: P:Applitools.TestResults.Matches
member.summary: Returns the total number of test steps that matched the baseline.

member.name: P:Applitools.TestResults.Mismatches
member.summary: Returns the total number of test steps that did not match the baseline.

member.name: P:Applitools.TestResults.Missing
member.summary: Returns the total number of baseline test steps that were missing in the test.

member.name: P:Applitools.TestResults.ExactMatches
member.summary: Returns the total number of test steps that exactly matched the baseline.

member.name: P:Applitools.TestResults.StrictMatches
member.summary: Returns the total number of test steps that strictly matched the baseline.

member.name: P:Applitools.TestResults.ContentMatches
member.summary: Returns the total number of test steps that matched the baseline by content.

member.name: P:Applitools.TestResults.LayoutMatches
member.summary: Returns the total number of test steps that matched the baseline by layout.

member.name: P:Applitools.TestResults.NoneMatches
member.summary: Returns the total number of test steps that matched the baseline without performing any comparison.

member.name: P:Applitools.Trigger.TriggerType
member.summary: The concrete trigger type.
Encapsulates an algorithm for creating full-page images of a page.
member.param: The logger to use.

A position provider used for saving the state before starting the stitching, as well as moving to (0,0). The reason it is separated from the stitchProvideris that the stitchProvider might have side-effects (e.g., changing the CSS transform of the page can cause a layout change at the top of the page), which we can avoid for the first screenshot (since it might be a full page screenshot anyway).
The position provider used for moving to the actual stitch points.
The time to wait before a call for capturing a screenshot. Used mainly for allowing the page to stabilize after a position was set.
An object responsible for storing the intermediate images created in the process, for debugging purposes.
The function used for actually taking sceeenshots.
The function used to create an object from the actual screenshot image.
member.returns: The screenshot as PNG byte array.

member.summary: Encapsulates an algorithm for creating full-page images of a page.

The reason it is separated from the stitchProvideris that the stitchProvider might have side-effects (e.g., changing the CSS transform of the page can cause a layout change at the top of the page), which we can avoid for the first screenshot (since it might be a full page screenshot anyway).
The position provider used for moving to the actual stitch points.
The time to wait before a call for capturing a screenshot. Used mainly for allowing the page to stabilize after a position was set.
An object responsible for storing the intermediate images created in the process, for debugging purposes.
The function used for actually taking sceeenshots.
The function used to create an object from the actual screenshot image.
member.returns: The screenshot as PNG byte array.
